data.title: A Star Is Born (2018)
data.summary: A musician helps a young singer and actress find fame, even as age and alcoholism send his own career into a downward spiral.

data.title: The Greatest Showman (2017)
data.summary: Celebrates the birth of show business, and tells of a visionary who rose from nothing to create a spectacle that became a worldwide sensation.

data.title: Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again (2018)
data.summary: Five years after the events of Mamma Mia! (2008), Sophie prepares for the grand reopening of the Hotel Bella Donna as she learns more about her mother's past.

data.title: Vox Lux (2018)
data.summary: An unusual set of circumstances brings unexpected success to a pop star.

data.title: Beauty and the Beast (2017)
data.summary: A selfish prince is cursed to become a monster for the rest of his life, unless he learns to fall in love with a beautiful young woman he keeps prisoner.

data.title: Mary Poppins Returns (2018)
data.summary: In Depression-era London, a now-grown Jane and Michael Banks, along with Michael's three children, are visited by the enigmatic Mary Poppins following a personal loss. Through her unique ...                See full summary »

data.title: Grease (1978)
data.summary: Good girl Sandy and greaser Danny fell in love over the summer. When they unexpectedly discover they're now in the same high school, will they be able to rekindle their romance?

data.title: La La Land (I) (2016)
data.summary: While navigating their careers in Los Angeles, a pianist and an actress fall in love while attempting to reconcile their aspirations for the future.

data.title: Climax (2018)
data.summary: French dancers gather in a remote, empty school building to rehearse on a wintry night. The all-night celebration morphs into a hallucinatory nightmare when they learn their sangria is laced with LSD.

data.title: Mamma Mia! (2008)
data.summary: The story of a bride-to-be trying to find her real father told using hit songs by the popular 1970s group ABBA.

data.title: Aladdin (2019)
data.summary: A live-action retelling of the 1992 Disney film of the same name.

data.title: The Sound of Music (1965)
data.summary: A woman leaves an Austrian convent to become a governess to the children of a Naval officer widower.

data.title: Les Misérables (2012)
data.summary: In 19th-century France, Jean Valjean, who for decades has been hunted by the ruthless policeman Javert after breaking parole, agrees to care for a factory worker's daughter. The decision changes their lives forever.

data.title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang (1968)
data.summary: A down-on-his-luck inventor turns a broken-down Grand Prix car into a fancy vehicle for his children, and then they go off on a magical fantasy adventure to save their grandfather in a far-off land.

data.title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (2005)
data.summary: A young boy wins a tour through the most magnificent chocolate factory in the world, led by the world's most unusual candy maker.

data.title: The Phantom of the Opera (2004)
data.summary: A young soprano becomes the obsession of a disfigured musical genius who lives beneath the Paris Opéra House. He kidnaps the soprano and forces the owners of the play to keep her as the lead role of the play.

data.title: The Wizard of Oz (1939)
data.summary: Dorothy Gale is swept away from a farm in Kansas to a magical land of Oz in a tornado and embarks on a quest with her new friends to see the Wizard who can help her return home to Kansas and help her friends as well.

data.title: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory (1971)
data.summary: A poor but hopeful boy seeks one of the five coveted golden tickets that will send him on a tour of Willy Wonka's mysterious chocolate factory.

data.title: The Blues Brothers (1980)
data.summary: Jake Blues, just out from prison, puts together his old band to save the Catholic home where he and brother Elwood were raised.

data.title: A Star Is Born (1954)
data.summary: A film star helps a young singer and actress find fame, even as age and alcoholism send his own career on a downward spiral.

data.title: The Rocky Horror Picture Show (1975)
data.summary: A newly engaged couple have a breakdown in an isolated area and must pay a call to the bizarre residence of Dr. Frank-N-Furter.

data.title: Into the Woods (2014)
data.summary: A witch tasks a childless baker and his wife with procuring magical items from classic fairy tales to reverse the curse put on their family tree.

data.title: Descendants 3 (2019)
data.summary: Plot kept under wraps.

data.title: Mary Poppins (1964)
data.summary: In turn of the century London, a magical nanny employs music and adventure to help two neglected children become closer to their father.

data.title: Labyrinth (1986)
data.summary: A 16-year-old girl is given 13 hours to solve a labyrinth and rescue her baby brother when her wish for him to be taken away is granted by the Goblin King.

data.title: The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas (1982)
data.summary: A town's Sheriff and regular patron of a historical whorehouse fights to keep it running when a television reporter targets it as the Devil's playhouse.

data.title: Kiss Me Kate (1953)
data.summary: An ex-husband and wife team star in a musical version of 'The Taming of the Shrew'; off-stage, the production is troublesome with ex-lovers' quarrels and a gangster looking for some money owed to them.

data.title: Rocketman (2019)
data.summary: The story of Elton John's life, from his years as a prodigy at the Royal Academy of Music through his influential and enduring musical partnership with Bernie Taupin.

data.title: West Side Story (1961)
data.summary: Two youngsters from rival New York City gangs fall in love, but tensions between their respective friends build toward tragedy.

data.title: Dumplin' (2018)
data.summary: Willowdean ('Dumplin'), the plus-size teenage daughter of a former beauty queen, signs up for her mom's Miss Teen Bluebonnet pageant as a protest that escalates when other contestants follow her footsteps, revolutionizing the pageant and their small Texas town.

data.title: Chicago (2002)
data.summary: Two death-row murderesses develop a fierce rivalry while competing for publicity, celebrity, and a sleazy lawyer's attention.

data.title: Moulin Rouge! (2001)
data.summary: A poet falls for a beautiful courtesan whom a jealous duke covets.

data.title: Robin Hood: Men in Tights (1993)
data.summary: A spoof of Robin Hood in general and Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves (1991) in particular.

data.title: Annie (1982)
data.summary: A young orphan girl's adventures in finding a family that will take her.

data.title: Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street (2007)
data.summary: The infamous story of Benjamin Barker, aka Sweeney Todd, who sets up a barber shop in London which is the basis for a sinister partnership with his fellow tenant, Mrs. Lovett.

data.title: Anna and the Apocalypse (2017)
data.summary: A zombie apocalypse threatens the sleepy town of Little Haven - at Christmas - forcing Anna and her friends to fight, slash and sing their way to survival, facing the undead in a desperate race to reach their loved ones. But they soon discover that no one is safe in this new world, and with civilization falling apart around them, the only people they can truly rely on are each other.

data.title: Hairspray (2007)
data.summary: Pleasantly plump teenager Tracy Turnblad teaches 1962 Baltimore a thing or two about integration after landing a spot on a local TV dance show.

data.title: Fiddler on the Roof (1971)
data.summary: In prerevolutionary Russia, a Jewish peasant contends with marrying off three of his daughters while growing anti-Semitic sentiment threatens his village.

data.title: Rock of Ages (2012)
data.summary: A small town girl and a city boy meet on the Sunset Strip, while pursuing their Hollywood dreams.

data.title: Grease 2 (1982)
data.summary: An English student at a 1960s American high school has to prove himself to the leader of a girls' gang whose members can only date greasers.

data.title: Burlesque (I) (2010)
data.summary: A small-town girl ventures to Los Angeles and finds her place in a neo-burlesque club run by a former dancer.

data.title: Madam Satan (1930)
data.summary: Angela and Bob Brooks are an upper class couple. Unfortunately, Bob is an unfaithful husband. But Angela has a plan to win back her husband's affections. An elaborate masquerade ball is to ...                See full summary »

data.title: The Great Ziegfeld (1936)
data.summary: The ups and downs of Florenz Ziegfeld Jr., famed producer of extravagant stage revues, are portrayed.

data.title: Singin' in the Rain (1952)
data.summary: A silent film production company and cast make a difficult transition to sound.

data.title: Fame (1980)
data.summary: A chronicle of the lives of several teenagers who attend a New York high school for students gifted in the performing arts.

data.title: Little Shop of Horrors (1986)
data.summary: A nerdy florist finds his chance for success and romance with the help of a giant man-eating plant who demands to be fed.

data.title: Dreamgirls (2006)
data.summary: A trio of black female soul singers cross over to the pop charts in the early 1960s, facing their own personal struggles along the way.

data.title: Annie (2014)
data.summary: A foster kid, who lives with her mean foster mom, sees her life change when business tycoon and New York City mayoral candidate Will Stacks makes a thinly-veiled campaign move and takes her in.

data.title: Popeye (1980)
data.summary: The adventures of the sailor man and his friends in the seaside town of Sweethaven.

data.title: Cry-Baby (1990)
data.summary: In 1950s Baltimore, a bad boy with a heart of gold wins the love of a good girl, whose boyfriend sets out for revenge.

data.title: Across the Universe (2007)
data.summary: The music of The Beatles and the Vietnam War form the backdrop for the romance between an upper-class American girl and a poor Liverpudlian artist.

data.title: My Fair Lady (1964)
data.summary: A snobbish phonetics professor agrees to a wager that he can take a flower girl and make her presentable in high society.

data.title: Rent (2005)
data.summary: This is the film version of the Pulitzer and Tony Award winning musical about Bohemians in the East Village of New York City struggling with life, love and AIDS, and the impacts they have on America.

data.title: Blues Brothers 2000 (1998)
data.summary: Elwood must reunite the old band, with a few new members, and go on another "Mission from God."

data.title: Wicked (II)
data.summary: The story of how a green-skinned woman framed by the Wizard of Oz becomes the Wicked Witch of the West; feature film based on the Broadway musical.

data.title: Nine (2009)
data.summary: Famous film director Guido Contini struggles to find harmony in his professional and personal lives, as he engages in dramatic relationships with his wife, his mistress, his muse, his agent, and his mother.

data.title: Earth Girls Are Easy (1988)
data.summary: A Southern California girl befriends three furry aliens after their spaceship lands in her swimming pool.

data.title: Newsies (1992)
data.summary: A musical based on the New York City newsboy strike of 1899. When young newspaper sellers are exploited beyond reason by their bosses they set out to enact change and are met by the ruthlessness of big business.

data.title: The King and I (1956)
data.summary: A widow accepts a job as a live-in governess to the King of Siam's children.

data.title: A Night at the Opera (1935)
data.summary: A sly business manager and two wacky friends of two opera singers help them achieve success while humiliating their stuffy and snobbish enemies.
